alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 9:50PM EST until February 24 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing drizzle is ongoing and expected to continue through early Friday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to four tenths of an inch possible. * WHERE...Garrett and Extreme Western Allegany Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM EST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 7 AM EST Thursday through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be treacherous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation may start as snow and sleet Thursday morning before becoming a prolonged period of freezing rain..
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
